result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard N. Ermilio was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any educational/treatment programs ordered by the agent.

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete 24- or 26-wk domestic abuse class.

Pay court costs and costs of supervision.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Petition and Order for Court-Appointed Attorney Compensation (submitted to Accts. Payable 10-19-16)

Defendant Richard N. Ermilio in court with attorney Jameson R. Whitney. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Plea agreement stated.  Def pleads no contest.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.  Sentence withheld for 1 year probation with conditions of any educational programs as ordered by agent; attend, pay for, succ. complete 24- or 26-wk d.a. class.
Status conference on July 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Richard N. Ermilio in court with attorney Jameson R. Whitney. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Jury trial scheduling requested but not yet set pending further status 7/13 at 1:30.  Status conference scheduled for July 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on June 29, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Richard N. Ermilio in court with attorney Jameson R. Whitney. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Formal reading waived.  NG entered.  Status requested and set.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
No special conditions.  Previous conditions of "no contact" have been ordered removed.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Richard N. Ermilio in court without counsel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin; states this is ADA Forehand's case.  Def states he just received the complaint.  Court informs def of his rights; will provide formal reading at a later date if so desired.  Def states he does not qualify for SPD; interested in Dean counsel.  Court questions def to determine if def is eligible for Dean counsel.  Court appoints Atty. Jameson Whitney.  Juen 1 at 1:30 for next date.  Def to repay Richland County for costs of Dean appointment - during pendency of case, to pay at rate of $50/mo beginning 4/15/16.  At case end, entire amount owed.  

Def asks for deletion of the no contact conditions of bond - states BH of HHS told him it would be deleted after today.  Court notes that bond set 3/24/16 stated that there was to be no contact with LE or AE unless allowed by HHS (discretion of HHS).  BH of HHS joins the hearing at this point - states HHS' position is that no contact may be dropped.  Court notes that no contact condition is dropped.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
